lines.text: [referring to a newspaper headline which reads "'Get Out of Town' District Attorney Tells Beer Barons"]
That's bad publicity for my business!
You've been reading the funny papers again, Owens.
lines.character: New York City Dist. Atty. Brent

lines.text: Look here, Brent, you can't get away with this! You can't put me...
I can't... but I will. You and every rat that hasn't found a hole to crawl into when that deadline is up.
lines.character: New York City Dist. Atty. Brent

lines.text: I've heard that before - just around election time.
Yes, but get this, Owens - you're a candidate right now for that "hot seat" at The Big House. And if you're in town by this time tomorrow, you're as good as elected.
lines.character: New York City Dist. Atty. Brent

lines.text: [after Breezy is wounded in a shootout with gangsters, the D.A. orders him to convalesce at his father's Wyoming ranch]
OK, Chief, if you think the department can get along without me.
Oh-ho, the department will probably go to pieces.
lines.character: New York City Dist. Atty. Brent

lines.text: Yeah, that's what I was afraid of!
Oh, if it does, I'll save you a piece.
lines.character: New York City Dist. Atty. Brent

lines.text: [Owens orders a henchman to shoot Martin Kildare's cattle]
Here's where beef goes down. Let 'em have it!

[pulls out a machine gun and aims it at the herd]
I'll play my best tune.
[Breezy and Walrus get the drop on Owens' thugs]
Now you fellas reach for a cloud and hang on to it.
[the Owens gang has just shot Martin Kildare]
The Owens mob just left here - they got my dad.
What?
You men follow the road... we're going to take the short cut and head 'em off at the rocks!

[punches Owens]
So you're tough, eh?
[punches him again]
You can dish it out, but you can't take it! Well, you're in a country now where you got to take it. Here's a little of what you gave to me!
[hits him again]
Don't I get a break?
You bet you don't! There's no lawyers here to pull a habeus corpus... but there's a gang here who can pull a rope! Get up.
Give me a break!
Surrre, we'll give you a break. We'll give you a rope and a tree that ain't never been used before.
[rather than face a hangman's rope, Butch shoots himself]
Still yellow, Butch. You couldn't take it.
[last lines]

[reads Breezy's train ticket]
Cheyenne to New York.
Yep, back to the big town. Now that Dad's well again, there's nothing to keep me here.
I wish it read the other way.
You mean Broadway to Cheyenne?
Uh-huh.
Shucks, there's no sense my going then... alone.
Unh-uh.
